bibl.title: M. L. Coovert for a Writ of Habeas Corpus. Bond

div1.p: U.S. Circuit Court District Washington
Ex Parte M. L. Coovert Bond.
Fuled Jul 31 1893 189 In the U. S. Circuit Court A. Reeves Ayres Clerk By R. M. Hopkins Deputy.
In the Circuit Court of the United States for the Ninth Circuit, District of Washington, Northern Division.
Ex parte V M. L. Coovert.
No. 6, 280 On Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus.
United States of America ) District of Washington, ) SS County of King. )

Know all men by these presents, That we, M. L. Coovert, of Vancouver, in the State of Washington, as principal, and of Seattle, in the State of Washington, as surety, are held and firmly bound unto the Clerk of the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington in the penal sum of Two Hundred and Fifty ($250) Dollars, lawful money of the United States, for the payment of which, well and truly to be mde, we, and each of us, bind ourselves, our heirs, executors and administrators, jointly severally and firmly by these presents.
Signed by our hands and sealed with our seals this 31 day of July, A. D. 1893.

The Condition of the foregoing obligation is such that Whereas, the said M. L. Coovert, principalabove named, was, on the 9th dy of June, 1893, arrested by George Nerton, Sheriff of the County of Clarke, in said state at Vancouver, in said county and state, by virtue of a varrant of commitment, issued by E. A. Wiswall, Judge of the Superior Court of the State of Washington for said County of Clarke, sitting and acting as a committing magistrate, for an alleged violation by said Coovert of a certain
law of the said State of Washington declaring it to be unlawful for any person or persons whatever to manufacture, buy, sell, give or furnish to anyone any cigarettes, cigarette paper or cigarette wrapper; it being charged that the said Coovert had sold to one C. M. McDonald a package of cigarettes, consisting of a slide pasteboard box, containing ten paper-wrapped cigarettes, packed in a paste board box, said box enclosed with others in a paper wrapper tied with strong cord, which said package was shipped to said Coovert by the American Tobacco Company form the State of Oregon to the State of Washington; all as more partiularlys set forth in the petition of the said M. L. Coovert, heretofore files herein, for a writ of habeas corpus; and

Whereas, on the 22nd day of June, 1893, said cause was duly heard in this court on a demurrer to the petition and on the return to the writ of habeas corpus issued out of this court on the 13th day of June, 1893; and

Whereas, in said cause, on the 22nd day of June, 1893, an order was duly made and entered discharging the said M. L. Coovert from the detention and imprisonment complained of in said petition, as aforesaid; and

Whereas, by said order of the 22nd day of June, 1893, it was ordered and required that the said M. L. Coovert should enter into a Bond in the sum of Two Hundred and Didty ($250.00) Dollars, with one or more sureties, for his appearance to answer the judgement of the appellate court herein,

Now, therefore, if the said M. L. Coovert shall appear and answer the judgement of the appellate court in the prmise, and abide by and obey such judgement or order as the appellate court may render or make, or cause to be rendered or made by the Circuit
Court of the United States above named, then this obligation to be void; otherwise to remain in full force and virtue.
Signed, Sealed & Delivered in Presence of M. L. Coovert (Seal) L. B. Stedeon M. A. Arilbin (Seal)
Taken and acknowledged before me this 31 day of July, 1893 R M Hopkins Deputy Clerk U. S. Circuit Court, District of Washington.
United States of America ) District of Washington. ) SS County of King. )

being first duly sworn, deposes and says: That he is the surety named in the foregoing Bond; that he is not a sheriff, clerk of court, attorney at law, or any other officer of any court in the State of Washington; that he is a citizen, resident and freeholder in said State of Washington, and is worth at least the sum of Two Hundred and Fifty ($250.00) Dollars, over and above all his just debts and liabilites, exclusive of property exempt from execution
M.A. Arilbin
Subscribed and swore to before me this 31 day of July, 1893. L. B. Stedeon Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle, King County, in said state.
